intro: Aulomyrcia albotomentosa var. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow-tomentose aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
